issue.title: [C++] Trying to set target properties on not existing CMake target
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-2930](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2930). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
/cpp/cmake_modules/BuildUtils.cmake:197 tries to set a target property on the shared arrow library. If ARROW_BUILD_SHARED is disabled, target is not available. This issue only affects APPLE builds.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2930?focusedCommentId=16562065) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
[~hoch.phil] can you make a pull request for this?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2930?focusedCommentId=16563243) by Philipp Hoch (hoch.phil):*
Sure, will do.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2930?focusedCommentId=16565360) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Issue resolved by pull request 2350
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2350>
